column5: Oh, Alicia...

column5: It's... The bullet wasn't of Imperial make.&It was a Gallian sniper rifle round, sir.
column6: C'est ... La balle n'<tait pas de marque Imp<riale. C'<tait&une cartouche de fusil de sniper de Gallian, monsieur.

column5: Wh-What?!

column5: And not just a normal round, either.&It's part of a new series still in testing.
column6: Et pas seulement une cartouche normale, en plus. Elle fait&partie d'une nouvelle s<rie encore en phase de test.

column5: So you're saying...&You think Alicia was shot by someone on our side?!

column5: I can't be completely sure, but...&I believe it's a very real possibility.
column6: Je ne peux pas en $tre compl>tement sur, mais...&je crois que c'est une possibilit< tr>s r<elle.

column5: But, why? What would anyone stand to gain&from shooting someone in their own camp?!
column6: Mais pourquoi? Qu'aurait on = gagner en tirant sur&quelqu'un dans son propre camp ?!

column5: Augh, those incompetents!&Why are they letting the Empire have their way?!

column5: With all due respect, General!&Our army isn't equipped to fight a Valkyria!

column6: Si nous nous retirons maintenant, comment vais-je&expliquer cela aux haut-plac<s? !

column6: L'arm<e imp<riale a alors fait retraite,&tandis que l'<treinte de Gallia sur la&victoire se renforcait.&&    Irene Koller, £Sur le front Gallian£
